title: Chaapa League : Organizers Pledge Spectacular Season 9 Grand Final
body_text:
The 9th season of the prestigious Chaapa League is set to climax on Saturday, September 21, 2024, with a grand finale at the NEC playground (Coffee Grounds) in Bugolobi, Kampala.
The Chaapa League, an annual alumni football event for Mbarara High School Old Boys, brings together over 30 teams competing for glory and unity.
Jacob Kabigumira, the Chairman of the Chaapa League, shared exciting details about the season’s finale.
He proudly announced that Rwizi, the Class of 2015 team, will officially be crowned champions of Season 9, dethroning last season’s winner, Chwezi. Rwizi’s dominance throughout the season has been a remarkable journey of teamwork and determination.
In addition to crowning the league champions, the event will feature the Bulls Tournament, a
thrilling competition where eight teams (Chogm FC, Dingswayo, Yobo Yobo, Msamiati, Kaatara, Mutakoha, 99 Dynamos, and Karasande) will battle for supremacy in the second edition of this tournament.
Each team will showcase a lady player, reflecting the league’s inclusivity and its growing commitment to women’s participation in sports.
Kabigumira extended an open invitation to the public, saying, “I invite our League partners, old boys, fans, family, and friends to join us as we climax Season 9 in a spectacular way. We shall also be recognizing the best performers and individuals, companies, and teams who have dedicated their invaluable service and contributed to the growth and development of the league.”
The grand finale promises a full day of exciting activities, including the recognition of top performers, such as the Top Scorer, MVP, and Best Goalkeeper, with winners set to receive customized medals and accolades.
Rwizi will take home the coveted championship shield and gold medals, while the Bulls Tournament champions will be rewarded with a trophy and medals.
Beyond the football pitch, the Chaapa League continues to expand in terms of stature and partnerships. With its exclusive merchandise line selling over 500 pieces since its launch in 2023.
The league’s spirit of inclusivity shines through with the Holistics (a ladies’ team from Maryhill High School) being an integral part of the competition.
